news.title: Nearly 50 States’ Attorneys General Join In Antitrust Investigation of Google
news.description: A multistate bipartisan coalition of attorneys general has formed for the purpose of investigating Google and other big tech companies’ control of internet advertising markets.

news.title: California Passes Bill That Threatens Uber and Lyft’s Business Model
news.description: Landmark legislation recently passed in California would make it easier to classify more workers as employees, and could result in an overhaul of the rideshare business.

news.title: Web Scraping Doesn’t Violate Anti-Hacking Law, Appeals Court Rules
news.description: The 9th Circuit Court of Appeals rejected LinkedIn’s claims that a data analytics company’s scraping of public profiles on its platform violated the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.

news.title: House Antitrust Panel Seeks Documents From 4 Big Tech Firms
news.description: Executives at Google, Amazon, Facebook, and Apple have received requests for email records and other communications as part of a Congressional investigation into big tech.
